Key Match Events: Luka Doncic scored 14 of his 32 points in the first quarter.
Dallas Mavericks achieved their highest-scoring first period of the season.
Franz Wagner led the Magic with 13 points, six rebounds, and six assists.
Orlando Magic made just eight of 41 3-point attempts and were outscored 52-36 in the paint.
Daniel Gafford scored 18 points for Dallas.
Kyrie Irving chipped in 17 points for Dallas.
Dallas Mavericks led by as many as 33 points.
Pre-Game Insights: Orlando Magic were missing 2023 Rookie of the Year Paolo Banchero due to an oblique injury.
Post-Match Reflections: Luka Doncic expressed enjoyment in the game, highlighting the team's defense, rebounding, and pace.
Mavs coach Jason Kidd praised Klay Thompson's playmaking and energy despite a quiet scoring night.
